clinical_study.brief_title: Randomized Evaluation of Vascular Entry Site and Radiation Exposure: REVERE Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Evaluation of Vascular Entry Site and Radiation Exposure: REVERE Trial.

oversight_info.authority: India: Indian Council of Medical Research

brief_summary.textblock: The study compares radiation exposure parameters between coronary angiography procedures performed by left wrist, right wrist or groin (femoral) procedure access site

detailed_description.textblock: Patients referred for coronary angiography will be randomized to either left radial, right radial or femoral arterial access sites, and the coronary angiogram will be performed in a standard fashion, including left ventriculography. Radiation exposure parameters including Air Kerma, Dose-area product, Fluoroscopy time and Operator radiation exposure will be recorded. Operator experience as well as demographic data will be recorded.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.description: The investigators will measure Air Kerma (cumulative) at the end of the procedure of coronary angiography.

other_outcome.description: operator radiation exposure will be measured by a personal dosimeter worn by the operator outside the lead apron on the vest pocket.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients undergoing diagnostic coronary angiography
Exclusion Criteria:
- non-availability of one or more of the three access sites History of coronary artery bypass graft surgery Need for percutaneous coronary intervention.
